title: Giants bench Carter again at start of MNF loss
content: Giants first-round pick Abdul Carter didn't start or play early in Monday night's matchup with the Patriots because of a coach's decision.

title: Patriots, led by 'conductor' Maye, first to 11 wins
content: QB Drake Maye turned in a masterful performance in a 33-15 beatdown of the visiting Giants on Monday night as the Patriots improved to an NFL-best 11-2 heading into their bye week.

title: 'Not playing soccer': Dart OK after Elliss' big hit
content: Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart took a bone-crushing hit near the sideline in the first quarter of Monday night's 33-15 loss to the Patriots, but he remained in the game and told reporters afterward that "this is football."

title: Sources: BYU's Sitake focus of Penn State search
content: The Penn State coaching search, which has gone quiet in the past few weeks, has focused on BYU coach Kalani Sitake, sources told ESPN on Monday, confirming a report by On3.

title: Sources: Mets give Devin Williams $51M contract
content: The New York Mets and reliever Devin Williams agreed to a three-year, $51 million deal, league sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan Monday night, giving the club a replacement for Edwin Diaz should the All-Star closer sign elsewhere.

title: Kiffin ready to make LSU nation's 'best program'
content: A day after flying out of Oxford, Mississippi, Lane Kiffin was introduced as LSU coach Monday, promising to restore the Tigers to being "the best program in all of college football," while detailing his excruciating decision to leave Ole Miss.

title: Brooks resumes LeBron trash talk in 33-point show
content: Dillon Brooks lit up the Lakers for 33 points in the Suns' 125-108 win Monday night, agitating both the Los Angeles crowd and LeBron James, whom he sparred with during the 2023 playoffs.

title: Wetzel: Lane Kiffin left an actual playoff team for a theoretical one. He should be honest about why
content: Lane Kiffin might be a great coach, but he isn't being treated unfairly by Ole Miss or "the calendar" or anything else.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus X factors for final stretch
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 14. We also picked out X factors for the last five weeks of the regular season.

title: From bed rest to champion: Inside Chet Holmgren's comeback
content: Holmgren was sidelined for three months last season because of a fractured pelvis and is "chasing for more" this season.

title: Can Texas make the playoff? Can any team win the ACC?
content: Why the Buckeyes are so dominant, the ACC is so confusing and the playoff picture still isn't settled.

title: Ranking the top 25 MLB offseason trade candidates -- and finding their best fits
content: From All-Star outfielders to elite aces, here are the big names your team could be targeting this winter.

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (19!), Broncos' D (51!)
content: The Browns vet and Denver are on pace to rewrite the single-season sacks record book. Here's how they got here.

title: Will Brandon Aiyuk return for the 49ers this season? Answering five top questions
content: San Francisco voided the WR's contract guarantees for next year. What does that mean for this season and beyond?

title: George Pickens, C.J. Stroud and a career day for a Jets WR highlight Next Gen Week 13
content: Pickens was a monster on slant routes while Stroud made the Colts pay for blitzing. Here are the highlights.

title: How a bald coach solved volleyball's ponytail predicament
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament will feature dozens of stars wearing a hair-tie solution invented by none other than three-time champion Jerritt Elliott.

title: The NHL's best this week: Kyle Palmieri, 'hockey guy'
content: The Islanders forward tore his ACL -- then made a brilliant pass to set up a goal. Plus, what to watch this week.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: Wolverines on the rise
content: The fourth in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Feast Week lessons: Michigan No. 1? St. John's, Florida in trouble?
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to a top-25 showdown in New York, here's what we learned last week.

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: UConn still the team to beat
content: The fourth in-season women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

title: Feast Week takeaways: Crooks' 47 points push Iowa State to 9-0
content: Big performances from Texas, LSU and Iowa State headline the most significant results from Feast Week.

title: Welcome to NFL draft season: 30 questions on the QBs, standout prospects and risers to watch
content: Who's in the hunt to go No. 1? How does the QB class look? Which teams need defense? And who could rise at the combine? Let's answer big questions on this class.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Can T.J. Parker climb back up the board?
content: We have draft notes, including what to make of T.J. Parker's three-sack game and Trevor Goosby's rise.

title: WNBA, union agree to 40-day extension on CBA
content: The WNBA and WNBA Players Association agreed to a 40-day extension on the current CBA that includes the option for either party to terminate the extension with 48 hours' notice.

title: Free agents: Kyle Monangai, Bam Knight are essential pickups
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we look ahead to Week 14 and the start of the fantasy football playoff season.

title: Buzz: Justin Herbert set for surgery, but aims to play in Week 14
content: Herbert set for surgery, Meyers keeps producing for the Jaguars and Irving looked good in his return in Week 14

title: What do the Big Six PL teams need to do ahead of January's transfer window?
content: With the January transfer window coming soon, what could the Big Six Premier League teams do to improve themselves for the rest of the season?

title: Chelsea, Arsenal put on a show of title hopefuls, Xabi Alonso's Madrid mess, more
content: Sunday's clash between Premier League title chasers lived up to expectations with drama, controversy and grit.

title: Allende outshines Messi as Miami book spot vs. Vancouver
content: Tadeo Allende's performance of a lifetime, and the own goal that broke San Diego hearts. Cesar Hernandez and Joseph Lowery to sum up the best and worst of MLS' conference finals as Inter Miami book a date with Vancouver.

title: Athletes Unlimited Softball League: Expansion and allocation draft
content: Who went No. 1 overall? Where did Maya Brady end up? All you need to know about the first AUSL player draft.

title: Huskers earn top overall seed in NCAA tournament
content: Undefeated Nebraska earned the No. 1 overall seed in the NCAA women's volleyball tournament bracket released Sunday.

title: 'Imran alive, mentally tortured': Sister Uzma meets jailed leader; big charge against Munir
content: Imran Khan's sister, Uzma Khanum, confirmed the former Pakistan PM is "completely fine" after a rare jail visit. Weeks of restricted access had sparked protests and death rumours. Despite court orders, family and party leaders faced repeated denials, leading to legal challenges and allegations of police brutality against protesting sisters. PTI seeks regular, unhindered access.

title: 'Chor ki daadhi mein tinka': BJP defends Sanchar Saathi app; jabs Cong over privacy row
content: Bharatiya Janata Party has responded to Congress accusations regarding the Sanchar Saathi app. BJP leaders stated the app aims to protect users from fraud and crime, not to monitor them. They emphasised that the application can be removed by users. Congress had alleged the directive was dictatorial and called the app a snooping tool.

title: Sri Lanka aid: Pak blames India again; mocked online for giving 'expired' relief
content: Pakistan accused India of delaying its humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka, claiming airspace permission was withheld. India refuted these allegations, stating the request was processed within four hours. Meanwhile, Pakistan's High Commission in Sri Lanka faced online criticism over relief packages with apparent near-expiry dates.

title: Suryavanshi hits 3rd T20 ton, but fastest-to-three record belongs to someone else
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi became the youngest centurion in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy history, scoring an unbeaten 108 for Bihar. His remarkable innings, however, wasn't enough as Maharashtra, led by Prithvi Shaw's 66, chased down Bihar's total to secure a victory. The result gave Maharashtra their second win from four matches in the group.

title: 'Code Red' at OpenAI: CEO Altman warns staff - leave everything, make ChatGPT better
content: OpenAI faces an internal 'code red' as Google's Gemini surges ahead, forcing a halt on revenue plans to fix ChatGPT's performance. Google's integrated infrastructure and custom chips give it a decisive edge. OpenAI's pivot highlights intense competition and financial pressures, as it scrambles to regain ground against a resurgent tech giant.

title: Sensex vs Gold: What should you opt for in 2026? Here’s the outlook
content: Indian stock markets are poised for a constructive 2026, driven by an improving earnings cycle, strong domestic liquidity, and normalizing valuations, says Ajay Menon, MD & CEO – Wealth Management, Motilal Oswal Financial Services. Which sectors should investors focus on? Will other emerging markets and even gold continue to outperform Indian equity benchmarks in 2026 as well?

title: Cyberfraud: Banks could be liable; authorities push lok adalat route for quick relief
content: Banks may face liability for cyber fraud losses if "due diligence" is found lacking, Haryana DGP OP Singh stated. Investigations will determine bank accountability for customer compensation.  The DGP also highlighted measures for faster release of frozen funds and an expanded awareness campaign involving students as cyber ambassadors.

title: 'Kill them all': Pete Hegseth's order is a feature of America's cowboy justice
content: Which brings us to Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth and the now-infamous “Kill Them All” directive. The mainstream American commentariat is working overtime to portray his alleged order — to eliminate the two survivors clinging to the wreckage of a bombed Caribbean vessel — as a shocking departure from established norms. But the truth is far less flattering. The Caribbean strike is not a fracture in American conduct. It is the logical expression of it. It is not an aberration. It is a revelation.

title: Workplace success: Satya Nadella says 'can't rely on brains alone'; reveals 'best tool'
content: In a world increasingly dominated by artificial intelligence, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella argues that emotional intelligence is essential for business leaders. He posits that while AI can manage technical tasks, the human touch—through empathy and collaboration—remains irreplaceable in driving success.

title: Trade reset: China issues rare earth licences; questions persist over wider access
content: China has issued new general export licenses for rare earth shipments, easing months of disruption caused by tighter controls. This move, following the Trump-Xi summit, allows year-long permits for specific customers, particularly in the auto sector. While easing some pressures, differences remain between Beijing and Washington regarding the extent of these changes.

title: 'What did poor dog do?' Rahul mocks row over pup in Parliament; BJP hits back
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi commented on Renuka Chowdhury bringing a stray dog to Parliament, stating pets are not allowed outside but "inside." Gandhi's remarks drew criticism from the BJP, who accused him of comparing opposition leaders to dogs. Chowdhury had brought the puppy after finding it near Parliament.

title: Delhi derailed: Tripura defeats star-studded side in Syed Mushtaq; script history
content: Delhi's domestic cricket woes deepened with a historic 12-run loss to Tripura in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. Chasing 158, Delhi's batting faltered on a slow pitch, finishing at 145 for 8. Indrajit Debnath's crucial last-over bowling secured Tripura's maiden win against Delhi, raising questions about team selection.

title: 'AI will destroy Zoho' - American investor Garry Tan; Vembu challenges him to bet
content: Zoho's chief, Sridhar Vembu, has passionately responded to the forecasts made by Y Combinator's Garry Tan, which suggest that AI's 'vibe coding' could extinguish the flame of Indian SaaS innovators. Vembu emphasized the strong trajectory of Zoho's customer base, casting doubt on the effectiveness of AI-generated applications for the nuanced requirements of businesses and raising alarms about potential technological debt.

title: Why Jaxson Dart wears eye black and a chain: The touching reason behind his ritual
content: New York Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart's sparkling necklace is more than just an accessory; it's a cherished gift from his sister. This meaningful charm, worn for every game, symbolizes family, faith, and a reminder to spread love and joy. Dart views it as a powerful connection to home, grounding him amidst the NFL's spotlight.

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Deep depression U-turns towards East Coast; red alert issued for Chennai
content: A deep depression, a remnant of Cyclone Ditwah, has turned back towards the east coast, prompting a red alert for Chennai and neighboring districts.  Extremely heavy rainfall is expected in northern Tamil Nadu. The system is currently very close to the coast and is forecast to weaken before making landfall south of Chennai.

title: SIR burden turns fatal: UP headmaster's heart attack raises alarm; 8 deaths in 10 days
content: Eight election workers have died in Uttar Pradesh during intensive revision duties in just ten days, including three suicides. A headmaster in Sambhal succumbed to a heart attack, with his family citing immense work pressure. Officials are facing scrutiny as teachers, often deployed due to manpower shortages, bear the brunt of demanding electoral tasks.

title: Bitcoin meltdown: Strategy stock tanks over 60%; retail ETF wipe-outs spark fresh fears
content: Investors who followed Michael Saylor's Bitcoin strategy are now facing heavy losses. Strategy Inc.'s stock has seen a sharp decline, causing leveraged funds tied to it to unwind. This has erased previous gains and is impacting asset retention for funds tracking the company's volatile Bitcoin bets.

title: What's cooking? Kohli seen having serious conversation with India selector ahead of 2nd ODI - watch
content: Team India has arrived in Raipur for the second ODI against South Africa, holding a 1-0 series lead. A video of Virat Kohli and selector Pragyan Ojha in an intense airport conversation has sparked fan speculation. Kohli's match-winning 135 in the first ODI was crucial to India's victory.

title: When pollution crosses the line: AQI 500 vs AQI 200 — what these numbers mean for your lungs
content: India's Air Quality Index (AQI) translates pollution levels into health risks, classifying air quality into six categories. PM2.5, a key pollutant, deeply impacts lungs and bloodstream, with levels of 200 causing noticeable stress and 500 leading to severe complications. Vulnerable groups like children and the elderly face heightened risks.

title: Ciara brings ‘sassy and saucy’ vibes to NYC photoshoot for Remix Magazine
content: Ciara graces the cover of Remix Magazine, discussing her new album "CiCi" and two decades in music. The interview highlights her creative independence and first project on her own label. The accompanying photoshoot showcases her commanding presence in a series of powerful business and fashion-forward looks against the New York City skyline.

title: 'Not for me to clarify': Bavuma plays down 'Grovel' remark; calls for more Tests against India
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma downplayed his coach's "grovel" comment, stating it wasn't a distraction for the team. Bavuma acknowledged the strength Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma bring to India's ODI side, noting their familiarity but also their significant experience. He also highlighted Marco Jansen's valuable all-round contributions and expressed a desire for more Test matches against top nations.

title: IPO boom continues! December set to be another big month - what's on the list?
content: India's primary market is set for a massive year-end, with December poised to raise nearly Rs 30,000 crore from around 25 IPOs. Major listings like ICICI Prudential AMC and Meesho are leading the charge. This surge, fueled by strong business confidence and discerning investors, signals robust market momentum extending into 2026.

title: IND vs SA: 'I was in school when Rohit Sharma played the 2007 T20 World Cup', says Temba Bavuma
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma acknowledges Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's significant impact on India's lineup, despite facing them before. He highlighted their crucial roles in the first ODI and expressed a desire for more high-quality bilateral series against top nations, humorously noting players' aging concerns.

title: 'Forced Pak ships to stay in ports': Navy chief on Op Sindoor; fleet on full alert
content: India's third indigenous nuclear-powered submarine is set for commissioning soon, announced Navy chief Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi. He also detailed how Operation Sindoor's aggressive naval action forced Pakistan's forces to remain near their coast. The Navy's extensive operations over the past year, including continuous anti-piracy duties and significant ship and flying hours, were also highlighted.

title: Sanchar Saathi App row: Can you delete it? Centre's big clarification after opposition's 'snooping' charge
content: Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia clarified that the Sanchar Saathi app is optional and can be deleted by users, refuting claims of mandatory pre-installation and disabling. The app aims to prevent cyber threats and track lost or stolen phones, not for snooping. This clarification follows a Reuters report about a government order for major smartphone companies.

title: 'One speech could set fire': Punjab opposes Amritpal's temporary release; hearing on Dec 8
content: Punjab government strongly opposed Amritpal Singh's temporary release to attend Parliament, fearing his speeches could destabilize the state.  The High Court has ordered the government to present specific evidence justifying the denial of his request. Amritpal is currently jailed under the NSA in Assam.

title: These guys deserve better! Ex-selectors say Rohit & Virat must stop being put on trial
content: Former selectors and experts urge Indian cricket to end the constant scrutiny of Rohit and Virat, highlighting their continued capability. Despite recent performances, the team management's approach to the 2027 World Cup preparation, particularly regarding the captaincy transition, has caused unease. Clear communication and a defined plan are crucial for the veterans and the team's future.

title: BB19: Amid speculation of a fallout, Rupali Ganguly extends her support to Gaurav Khanna
content: Rupali Ganguly, Gaurav Khanna's former co-star from 'Anupamaa', has publicly backed him for the Bigg Boss 19 finale. While praising other contestants, Ganguly declared Khanna deserves to win the trophy. This support comes amidst past rumors of a rift between the two actors.

title: Winter pain: How Delhi’s pollution spikes are mirroring traffic hours
content: A CSE analysis reveals Delhi-NCR's early winter pollution spikes are closely linked to traffic emissions, with PM2.5 and nitrogen dioxide rising in tandem. Persistent carbon monoxide exceedances highlight ongoing vehicular pollution, even as farm fire contributions decrease. The report urges a focus on cleaner vehicles and fuels to combat the elevated, plateauing pollution levels.

title: 8th Pay Commission update: Centre breaks silence on basic pay–DA merger; key details
content: The central government has clarified it is not considering merging dearness allowance (DA) with basic pay for employees and pensioners. This comes as unions demand an interim merger due to rising inflation.

title: Pandya’s blazing 77* powers Baroda to record chase; fan breaks security cordon - watch
content: Hardik Pandya made a strong comeback to competitive cricket. He scored an unbeaten 77 to guide Baroda to a seven-wicket win against Punjab. Baroda chased down 223 runs. Pandya finished the match with three consecutive sixes. This marks an encouraging return after his injury.

title: Did Pakistan send expired aid to flood-hit Sri Lanka? Social media pokes fun
content: Pakistan's High Commission in Sri Lanka drew online flak for its relief material photos, with critics questioning the origin of the biscuits shown. Meanwhile, India swiftly denied blocking Pakistan's airspace for aid delivery, confirming an overflight request was approved promptly on Monday. This highlights a diplomatic exchange amidst Sri Lanka's flood crisis.

title: WhatsApp spy held in Rajasthan: Pak agent traced near military zone; army routes, data, OTPs leaked
content: Rajasthan CID Intelligence apprehended Prakash Singh alias Badal from Firozpur for allegedly spying for Pakistan's ISI. He was caught transmitting sensitive Indian Army information from Rajasthan, Punjab, and Gujarat to Pakistani handlers via social media. Singh also facilitated ISI agents in using Indian SIM cards for espionage by providing OTPs, receiving monetary compensation for his actions.

title: Trump’s flashy golf moment with Wayne Gretzky sparks debate on his 38 titles
content: Donald Trump's recent golf outing, featuring a chip-in shot and a claim of 38 club championships, has reignited discussions about his golfing prowess. Playing alongside legends like Wayne Gretzky and Brooks Koepka, Trump's performance and boasts, including a victory over a younger player, continue to fuel his athletic narrative, drawing both admiration and skepticism from observers.

title: Delhi: Mercedes G-63 driver who killed chef, injured 2 gets bail; victim's family demands action
content: A software engineer, Shivam Arora, accused of causing a chef's death and injuring two others in a Mercedes G-63 crash, has been granted bail. Police stated the charges were bailable. The victim's family, devastated by the loss of their sole breadwinner, is demanding strict action and compensation, highlighting their shattered lives.

title: 'Red carpet for intruders?' SC's sharp stance on Rohingya plea; questions legal basis
content: The Supreme Court questioned the obligation to illegal entrants during a hearing on Rohingya disappearances. The court asked if 'intruders' should receive a 'red carpet welcome'. The bench emphasized that if individuals lack legal status, deportation is a valid consideration. The court pondered the implications of illegal entry followed by demands for legal protections.

title: No Punjab district in farm-fire top 10; MP leads
content: Punjab has achieved a significant reduction in stubble burning, with no districts in the top 10 worst offenders this year. Madhya Pradesh now leads, reporting the highest number of cases. This turnaround follows strict measures and behavioral changes among farmers in Punjab and Haryana, while other states have become new hotspots.

title: First-day jitters in Bihar assembly: JD(U)’s Vibha Devi fumbles reading oath lines
content: JD(U) MLA Vibha Devi faced difficulty reading her oath at the Bihar Vidhan Sabha's inaugural session. Other newly elected legislators shared their plans for the state. The NDA secured a significant victory in the recent elections, winning over 200 seats. BJP emerged as the largest party, followed by JD(U). Opposition parties like RJD and Congress secured fewer seats.

title: 'Equity capital dried up': Chinese electronic brands reel under India's regulatory hurdle
content: Chinese electronics giants like Oppo and Vivo are increasingly relying on loans from their group companies to fund Indian operations. This shift to external commercial borrowings (ECBs) stems from roadblocks in securing equity funding due to Press Note 3 (PN3) rules and regulatory actions, making bank loans difficult. The funding challenges are impacting expansion plans for some firms.

title: Exclusive: Sindarov wins WC in Goa; 'closest friend' Assaubayeva targets her 'unfinished task'
content: Uzbekistan's 19-year-old Javokhir Sindarov made chess history by becoming the youngest FIDE World Cup champion, earning a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament.  Kazakhstan's Grandmaster Bibisara Assaubayeva, a two-time World Blitz Champion, expressed immense pride in Sindarov's achievement.  Assaubayeva, who will play for American Gambits in the upcoming season of GCL, now aims to qualify for the Women's Candidates next year.

title: Prashant Bhushan Calls Poll Body "Despot". Supreme Court Objects
content: Senior advocate Prashant Bhushan, while making submissions on legality of the Special Intensive Revision of voter lists or SIR in the Supreme Court today, used a derogatory term for the Election Commission.

title: "Source Of Strength": Khaleda Zia's Son After PM Modi's Post Extending Support
content: BNP chief Tarique Rahman saidthe offers of support from leaders across the world have been a "source of immense strength".

title: 'Dec 21, Not Dec 3': High Court On Maharashtra Local Body Poll Results
content: The Nagpur bench of the Bombay High Court on Tuesday directed the Maharashtra State Election Commission (SEC) to hold the counting of votes for all the local body polls on December 21, instead of December 3.

title: Rahul Gandhi Adds Fuel To Dog Row, Says Pets Allowed Inside Parliament
content: Adding fuel to the controversy sparked by his party colleague Renuka Chowdhury, who said "those who bite are inside Parliament" after she reached the complex with a dog, Rahul Gandhi has quipped that pets are allowed inside the legislature.

title: New Complex Housing PM's Office Renamed As 'Seva Teerth': Sources
content: The Prime Minister's Office or the PMO will be renamed Seva Teerth, in line with citizen-first governance, sources have told NDTV.

title: "Roads Can't Hold Crowd He Draws": No Nod for Vijay's Puducherry Roadshow
content: Puducherry Police have refused permission for actor Vijay's proposed December 5 roadshow and have instead advised him to hold a public meeting in an open ground, prompting uncertainty within his Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK).

title: Air India Under Probe For Operating Aircraft With Expired Safety Certificate
content: Air India is under regulatory scrutiny by the aviation watchdog after one of its 164-seater A320 aircraft, operated eight times on November 24 and 25, despite an expired airworthiness review certificate.

title: "We Understand There Is Pressure Over India": Russia On US Tariffs
content: Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Tuesday addressed concerns over India facing high US tariffs for purchasing Russian oil, saying Moscow recognises the challenge but will not intervene in New Delhi's bilateral issues with Washington.

title: "DK Shivakumar To Be Chief Minister If...": Siddaramaiah Leaves Decision To Congress
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah met his deputy, DK Shivakumar, for a 'power breakfast' Tuesday morning, a meeting between the state's two most important leaders that under any other circumstances might have seem normal.

title: Kerala Request To Extend SIR Form Deadline "Just And Fair": Supreme Court
content: Terming a petition by the Kerala government to extend the date for submission of forms for the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) "just and fair", the Supreme Court on Tuesday advised the Election Commission to consider the proposal.

title: "Do We Give A Red Carpet Welcome?" Chief Justice In Rohingya Missing Case
content: Coming down heavily on a petition that sought the tracking of five missing Rohingya, Chief Justice of India Surya Kant has asked if the country should roll out a red carpet for illegal immigrants

title: Exclusive: Pakistan Constructs New Buildings, Removes Destroyed Hangar At Bases Struck By Air Force
content: New high-resolution satellite imagery with NDTV indicates that Pakistan has cleared out debris of a hangar at its airbase in Sukkur, struck by the Indian Air Force during Operation Sindoor on May 10 this year.

title: Muslim Cleric's Call On Microphone Saves 7 People In Sinking Vehicle
content: The vehicle had lost control, skidded off the National Highway and plunged into a pond in Assam's Sribhumi district.

title: What Makes Russia's S-500 Different From Its Predecessor S-400
content: Easily one of the biggest weaponry success stories of Operation Sindoor is the Russian-built S-400 air defence missile system, five regiments of which were ordered from Moscow in 2018.

title: How Deforestation Turbocharged Indonesia's Deadly Floods
content: Environmentalists, experts and even Indonesia's government have pointed to the role forest loss played in flash flooding and landslides.

title: Afghan Taliban Authorities Publicly Execute Man For Murder
content: The execution brought to 12 the number of men publicly put to death since the Taliban returned to power in 2021, according to an AFP tally.

title: Top Court Stays POCSO Trial Against Ex-Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa
content: A bench comprising Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi passed the interim order while hearing Yediyurappa's plea challenging the Karnataka High Court's refusal to quash the case.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United lead race for Gallagher
content: Manchester United, Newcastle, Everton and Tottenham Hotspur are all interested in signing Atlético Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: ‘Education turning into a breeding ground for hyper-nationalism’
content: Civil society leaders pledge to draft an alternative people’s education policy as protest meet demands scrapping of NEP 2020 and PM SHRI

title: School bus gutted after ‘clash’ between driver, cleaner in Prakasam district
content: No casualties reported as the incident took place when no students were inside the bus; police yet to confirm reason behind the incident

title: RTI reveals former Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy spent ₹222.85 crore on air travel
content: In contrast, RTI responses from the four departments headed by Nara Lokesh show that the Minister has not claimed a single rupee from the government for official travel, with all tickets, including special flights, fully self-funded

title: Minister inspects Vijayawada Rythu Bazaar, directs officials to ensure fair pricing and better sanitation
content: Nadendla Manohar stresses that the State government’s foremost priority is to ensure that the public has access to quality agricultural products at fair and affordable prices; directs officials to monitor the quality of rice and other food grains sold in the market

title: Cricket stars, selfies, security slips: Punjab vs Haryana thriller in Hyderabad draws 10,000 fans
content: Uppal stadium packed as Hardik Pandya and Abhishek Sharma put on star-studded show, prompting repeated pitch invasions, helping Baroda win

title: CM chairs review meeting on progress of Nalam Kaakkum Stalin initiative
content: Stalin instructs officials to ensure basic facilities at the health camps and deploy enough volunteers to guide the public

title: Ahead of International Day of Persons with Disabilities, CM calls for inclusive society
content: Stalin says the Tamil Nadu government places strong emphasis on the welfare of persons with disabilities

title: First-of-its-kind financial literacy programme in Kerala’s schools
content: General Education department’s SCERT and Reserve Bank of India join hands for the programme that will begin with a training for teachers who in turn will tutor students

title: Singareni, CSIR-IMMT sign pact on exploration of rare minerals from mining waste
content: SCCL CMD N. Balram says IMMT would further examine, analyse and study feasibility for extraction of rare minerals

title: Doctor-population ratio in the country is 1:811, Health Ministry tells Parliament
content: There has been a significant increase in the number of medical colleges, and undergraduate and post-graduate medical seats in the country, Health Minister J.P. Nadda said

title: For Kolkata fans, money doesn’t matter when it comes to Messi
content: The football legend last came to the city in 2011 to captain Argentina in a friendly match against Venezuela at the Salt Lake City stadium, the same venue for an upcoming event that will include a celebrity match and a masterclass

title: TTD launches ‘Train the trainees’ programme for Srivari Sevaks
content: The initiative is aimed at transforming the sevaks into ambassadors of Hindu Sanatana Dharma and enhancing standards of religious management

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Doctors’ body urges Telangana govt. to appoint medical professional as KNRUHS Vice-Chancellor
content: Telangana Government Doctors Association voices concern over reports that the government may appoint an IAS officer as the temporary vice-chancellor

title: Control room, toll-free helpline set up to resolve paddy procurement issues in Andhra Pradesh
content: Farmers facing issues at the procurement centres can dial 1967 to receive immediate support, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar

title: Tenkalai entitled to recite Prabandham at Kancheepuram Devarajaswamy Temple: Madras High Court
content: Justices R. Suresh Kumar and S. Sounthar hold that the courts have consistently ruled in favour of Tenkalai since 1882 and therefore, Vadakalai cannot interfere with the rights of the other sect

title: Scope of ISIS Investigation Research Cell in NIA broadened: Govt
content: A specialised unit— the National Terror Data Fusion and Analysis Centre (NTDFAC)— has been established in the NIA for enabling big data analytics

title: PUCL demands judicial inquiry into custodial torture and death of 28-year-old delivery executive
content: PUCL’s report alleges that Darshan was detained illegally by Viveknagar police for four days, and brutally assaulted with lathis and pipes. Despite repeated visits by his mother on November 13, officers allegedly refused to release him.

title: Lok Sabha to take up debate on Vande Mataram on Dec. 8; electoral reforms on Dec. 9, says Kiren Rijiju
content: The decision was taken after an all-party meeting and a Business Advisory Committee (BAC) chaired by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, signalling that the logjam prevailing in both Houses

title: ‘Politics is not permanent’: CM Siddaramaiah’s statement goes viral
content: After the breakfast meeting, in a reply to a question on when Mr. Shivakumar will become the CM, Mr. Siddaramaiah was quick to reply, “When the high command takes a decision.”

title: Opposition shedding crocodile tears on Manipur, indulging in drama: Finance Minister in Rajya Sabha
content: "Even today, when the GST benefits have to go to the State Government, they are not here to participate. All the grievances [on Manipur] they are all just drama. I am sorry to say this," says Nirmala Sitharaman

title: Tamil Nadu govt. to provide  compensation of ₹20,000 per  hectare for crop damage in October rain, says Revenue  Minister
content: The announcement comes a day after Chief Minister M.K. Stalin asked officials to disburse compensation to farmers as the rain had damaged agricultural crops on about 4,235 hectares and horticultural crops on 345 hectares

title: JSW setting up $90 million military drone plant in Hyderabad
content: V-BAT drone manufacturing at the facility of JSW Defence is expected to commence by last quarter of 2026, said the Group

title: Kerala and Tamil Nadu join forces to mine mineral sand
content: KMML’s assessment is that obtaining ilmenite, the raw material for manufacturing titanium dioxide, from Tamil Nadu is profitable. Tamil Nadu has proposed that mining and value addition occur exclusively within its borders, aiming at enhancing production capacity for both States.

title: Kerala’s push for extension of enumeration phase of SIR is ‘just, fair’; needs ‘deep consideration’ by ECI: SC
content: The apex court directed Kerala to make a representation with the ECI, detailing its reasons for an extension by December 3; the court urged the ECI to consider the representation of the State ‘sympathetically and objectively’ in the next two days

title: TNSTC bus rams into house in Tiruvannamalai
content: M.S. Dharani Vendhan, Arani MP from the DMK, inspected the accident spot and gave a cheque of ₹1 lakh to the family of the house owner.

title: New complex housing PMO to be called ‘Seva Teerth’
content: The new complex, which is in the final stages of completion, was earlier known as the 'Executive Enclave' under the Central Vista Redevelopment project

title: Military presence in Lakshadweep to go up with new naval detachment on Bitra: Vice Admiral Sameer Saxena
content: Navy eyeing greater infrastructure development in Lakshadweep Islands, while keeping in mind need to protect the fragile ecosystem, according to Vice Admiral Sameer Saxena, Flag Officer Commanding-in-Chief (FOC-in-C), Southern Naval Command

title: Transport wing employees union demands restoration of pre-merger medical facilities for retired employees
content: Before the merger, lifetime medical benefits worth ₹4 lakh were provided to both employees and their spouses in referral hospitals, in addition to free treatment and medicines in RTC hospitals, the union leaders said

title: Coimbatore gang-rape: Police file charge-sheet against three accused men
content: The police team submitted the charge-sheet within a period of one month, as instructed by Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin.

title: BJP defends Sanchar Saathi as an app that secures mobile devices and users; rejects snooping charge
content: BJP MP and spokesperson Sambit Patra said the app had so far helped detect and disconnect about 1.75 crore fraudulent mobile connections, trace close to 26 lakh stolen/missing phones, and recover 7.5 lakh phones

title: Bananas sold for a price less than a matchbox:   Former Andhra CM Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: “If food is sold at 50 paise per kilo, what is the value of the labour that produces that food?” Jagan Mohan Reddy questioned, urging immediate intervention

title: Opposition stages walkout from Rajya Sabha demanding timeline for discussion on ‘electoral reforms’
content: As the government refused to give preference to the debate on SIR, Opposition MPs raised slogans in the Upper House and later staged a walkout

title: Opposition cannot dictate the timeline for SIR debate: Kiren Rijiju
content: Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said government is willing to discuss the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls

title: Apple to resist India order to preload state-run Sanchar Saathi app as political outcry builds
content: The Indian government has confidentially ordered companies including Apple, Samsung and Xiaomi to preload their phones with an app called Sanchar Saathi

title: Rahul flags 'menace of drugs, illegal liquor, farmers plight' in Gujarat, slams BJP
content: Women are taking to the streets in large numbers because criminals are receiving protection from those in power, while they themselves are met only with neglect, he claimed

title: In a first, Tiruchi’s Golden Rock Railway Workshop to carry out overhauling of Vande Bharat train coaches
content: One rake consisting of 16 coaches arrives at the workshop for overhauling; plan is to complete the task in 45 days

title: Supreme Court stays POCSO trial against former Karnataka CM Yediyurappa
content: Court questions the validity of the charges as Yediyurappa’s defence argues lack of credible evidence, highlighting the former CM’s distinguished political career amidst serious allegations

title: Janmabhoomi Express to have new train number from February 15, 2026
content: Passengers/rail users are requested to note the changes in the Public Time Table in the NTES app or enquire by calling on the unified enquiry no.139

title: Census to be done in two phases between April 2026 and February 2027, says government
content: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said the two phases will be — Phase I-House Listing and Housing Census followed by Phase II–Population Enumeration (PE)

title: VIT Bhopal violence: M.P. govt. says management's bid to cover up jaundice outbreak, insensitive attitude triggered violence
content: Acting on findings of a three-member panel’s report, the Madhya Pradesh Higher Education Department issued a show-cause notice to the institution’s chancellor, demanding an explanation within seven days

title: Supreme Court gives green light for Kerala to allot open prison land to BrahMos
content: BATL would be apportioned 180 acres, SSB 45 acres to set up a battalion headquarters and 32 acres for the forensic varsity

title: CCMB study reveals microbial diversity in Eastern Ghats lakes
content: Lakes inside protected areas showed significantly higher bacterial richness, while those near industrial zones exhibited reduced diversity

title: A year after landslip, Tiruvannamalai’s Arunachala Hills gears up for annual Maha Deepam
content: On December 2, Maha Deepam team carried cauldron (kopparai) on the northeast of the hills. They avoided their traditional southeast route to carry the materials atop the hills after landslip occurred there last December.

title: Bengal government did not implement Central fisheries scheme for two years: Centre
content: Union Fisheries Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh said the Bengal government accepted the PMMSY scheme two years after it was launched in 2020-21

title: ‘Slow’ pace of Edapally-Mannuthy NH 544 works: Kerala HC directs NHAI to submit report on project deadline
content: Thrissur Collector submits that works on the congested corridor, which began in September 2024, was not progressing as expected and that safety issues prevailed in the form of insufficient street lighting and inadequate hazard sign boards

title: Karur stampede: Shift of probe to CBI undermines State autonomy; sets dangerous precedent, Tamil Nadu tells Supreme Court
content: Tamil Nadu said the Supreme Court cited the “political undertones” of the case as a reason to transfer the probe from a SIT of senior Tamil Nadu police officers to the CBI

title: Bombay High Court defers local body poll counting to December 21, sparks political outcry
content: The High Court, while hearing a bunch of petitions challenging the SEC’s decision, also directed that exit polls should not be announced till December 20

title: Why Sanchar Saathi is a state-owned surveillance app that Indian users don’t need
content: This is not a user-chosen convenience layer but state-mandated software that can, even if unintentionally, create pathways for monitoring which device belongs to whom, how devices move, when they are active or inactive, and how they interact with telecom networks

title: Sanchar Saathi app optional, can be deleted, says Telecom Minister Scindia
content: Jyotiraditya Scindia, Minister of Communications, said in Parliament that the Sanchar Saathi app could be deleted by users, and was optional

title: DoT’s WhatsApp SIM-binding mandate faces pushback from Broadband India Forum
content: BIF said the DoT’s order was “well-intentioned,” but it raised “significant questions of jurisdiction, proportionality, and consumer impact”

title: Parity cannot be sole ground for granting bail to accused in criminal case: Supreme Court
content: The bench said relief of bail cannot be granted without due regard to the circumstances involved in the alleged offence for which the accused person has been arrested

title: Karur stampede: Retired Supreme Court judge-led committee at Karur to monitor ongoing CBI probe
content: Over the next two days, retired judge Rastogi’s team is scheduled to meet families of the deceased and the injured to document their grievances and concerns.

title: BJP leader Prem Kumar unanimously elected Speaker of Bihar assembly
content: Pro-tem Speaker Narendra Narayan Yadav informed the House that Prem Kumar was the only candidate whose name figured for the post

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Heavy rains to continue in Chennai, neighbouring districts; deep depression to weaken on December 2 night
content: As the weather system is weakening gradually and is positioned close to the north T.N. coast, the RMC has issued a yellow alert for Chennai, Tiruvallur, Chengalpattu and Kancheepuram districts

title: Sanchar Saathi: DoT order to phone makers to ‘pre-install’ app gets significant pushback
content: Rajya Sabha MP Priyanka Chaturvedi from the Shiv Sena (UBT) said “Sanchar Saathi mobile app mandate by the GoI is nothing but another BIG BOSS surveillance moment”

title: Kharge, Sonia, Rahul, other Opposition MPs protest against SIR in Parliament complex
content: Congress leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, DMK’s K. Kanhimozhi and T.R. Baalu were among the Opposition leaders protesting in front of Parliament’s Makar Dwar

title: New passenger pick-up rules at Bengaluru airport to come into effect from December 8
content: The enhanced pick-up measures are expected to streamline passenger movement, reduce congestion, and improve safety, discipline, and overall convenience at arrival areas

title: Eleven arrested; trawler seized for illegal fishing in turtle habitation zones in Odisha's Gahirmatha
content: The marine fishermen, who hail from Kendrapara district, were sent to judicial custody after their arrest December 1

title: Remand prisoner found dead with throat slit in Kannur Central Jail in Kerala
content: The Wayanad native was in jail after being accused of murdering his wife. Police have registered a case of unnatural death

title: Tamil Nadu woman killed in bus accident in Karnataka; four injured rushed to Madanapalle hospital
content: According to the police, the bus, which was enroute to Bengaluru from Kadapa, hit the median around 4 a.m., and overturned

title: Cyclone Ditwah LIVE: Deep depression expected to recurve towards Chennai, 4 districts likely to receive heavy spells
content: Death toll in Sri Lanka rises to 410, with 336 people missing, according to the latest update from the Disaster Management Centre.

title: Vijayawada MP thank Civil Aviation Minister for permitting ‘Irumudis’ on flights
content: Vijayawada MP Sivanath also urged the Civil Aviation minister to run Vijayawada-Dubai direct flight, as many people from Andhra Pradesh are living in Dubai

title: Six flights cancelled at Chennai airport citing operational reasons
content: Flights to destinations including Guwahati, Jaipur, Bhubaneswar, Kochi and Mumbai, were cancelled by the airlines due to operational reasons, AAI said

title: Chennai Metro Rail train suffers glitch near High Court station, passengers forced to walk inside tunnel
content: The train halted inside the tunnel between Chennai Central station and High Court station a few minutes after departing the station at 5:45 a.m.

title: ‘Shivakumar and I will always remain brothers, work together in 2028 Assembly elections,’ says CM Siddaramaiah
content: Though the meeting was largely seen as a ‘courtesy call’, the CM’s visit to the Deputy CM’s residence is believed to have brought Mr. Shivakumar to the centre stage of Karnataka politics

title: BJP has not prioritised cultural heritage: Archaeologist K.K. Muhammed
content: “When the BJP had come to power, we had expected that there would be qualitative and quantitative change as far as protection, conservation and excavation of sites was concerned, but that has not happened,” archaeologist K.K. Muhammed said

title: IndiGo flight from Kuwait to Hyderabad diverted to Mumbai after hoax bomb threat
content: An email warning of an explosive device was sent to the GMR airport authorities at around 5.15 a.m., prompting the immediate diversion of the flight 6E1234

title: Survivor Series WarGames: Who is the masked man who attacked CM Punk?
content: mystery fighter interrupts main event of WarGames to help Brock Lesnar, Bron Breakker and their team win . AJ Lee pinned Becky Lynch in the women's wargames match . that's the biggest question after Saturday's Survivor Series .

title: Will there be baseball in 2027? Is a salary cap coming? What you need to know about MLB's looming labor battle﻿
content: the league's current labor agreement expires on Dec. 1, 2026 . there are major hurdles to clear and some key areas of disagreement . a lockout would shut down free agency and trades, as it did in 2021 .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who in? Who's out? Who needs help to make the bracket
content: Paul Finebaum says the 12-team college football playoff will be messier than ever . if both BYU and Texas Tech are in from the Big 12, someone currently in the top 10 is out . how the committee votes in the fifth ranking will be a strong indicator of how the field will look on Selection Day .

title: All-Star predictions: Which stars will we see in USA vs. the World?
content: the first selection process for the new USA vs. the world format this season will work almost the same as it has in the past . if the class of 24 All-Stars doesn't split perfectly into 16 american and eight international players . commissioner Adam Silver will add extra players to the roster to meet those minimums .

title: Where Kentucky ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . the ouster of James Franklin sent a message around the sport: Almost no coach is safe . there are now nine schools looking for head coaches: UCLA, Cal, and now Michigan State .

title: MLB offseason grades: Reliever Devin Williams joins Mets after rough season with Yankees
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if you're a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: NFL Week 14 odds: Bears underdogs at Packers, Ravens favored over Steelers
content: the Dallas Cowboys visit the Detroit Lions as underdogs on "Thursday Night Football" the cowboys have back-to-back wins over the Philadelphia Eagles and Kansas City Chiefs . the Lions are coming off a loss at home to the Green Bay Packers .

title: Lane Kiffin, Thanksgiving and CFB conference champs: A busy weekend at sportsbooks
content: oddsmakers think Lane Kiffin's departure from Ole Miss triggered a guessing game at sportsbooks . the mercurial coach will not be heading into the college football playoff . oddsmakers say he's worth upwards of four points .

title: Solak's Week 13 panic meter: Time to be worried about the Steelers?
content: the Steelers should move on from Mike Tomlin after an embarrassing home loss to the Bills . every Tuesday, I'll spin the previous week of NFL action forward . we'll seek measured reactions to everyone's overreactions, celebrate the exciting stuff nobody is appreciating .

title: 🏈 CFB Power Rankings: Texas Tech into top five
content: coach's prolonged employment decision didn't really qualify as surprising for those who have followed his career . Trinidad Chambliss was one of the season's most delightful surprises . he finished the regular season with 3,016 passing yards and 18 touchdowns .

title: Drake Maye strengthens MVP case against Giants; Patriots win 10th straight
